thread.title: Job openings dropped slightly in June
thread.title_full: Job openings dropped slightly in June

author: rshabad@thehill.com (Rebecca Shabad)
title: Job openings dropped slightly in June
text:
Job openings dropped slightly in June Getty Images By Rebecca Shabad - 08/12/15 03:24 PM EDT 
The number of job openings in the United States dropped slightly in June, the Labor Department said Wednesday. 
By the end of June, there were 5.25 million job openings, slightly down from a record 5.36 million in May. ADVERTISEMENT May’s number of job openings was the highest on record — marking the most job openings in a month since the government began tracking them in 2000.
Job openings over the last year expanded for many industries, the report said, with the largest growth in professional and business services, healthcare and social assistance. By contrast, openings fell in mining and logging industries and in finance and insurance. 
The monthly survey found 5.18 million people were hired in June, 2.75 million voluntarily quit their jobs and 1.79 million were laid off or discharged in June. 
This comes after a positive jobs report last Friday, which said the economy added 215,000 jobs in July and the unemployment rate remained unchanged at 5.3 percent.
